word: In a second letter, written on the way to Wittenberg, Luther added: “Behold me ready to bear your highness’ disapprobation, and the anger of the whole world. Are not the Wittenbergers my own sheep? Has not God committed them to my care? and ought I not, if need be, to lay down my life for them? Besides, I dread lest we should see, throughout Germany, a revolt by which God shall punish our nation.”
